snippet: Federal efforts to control runaway tuition growth fail to account for the rising salaries that universities are paying to attract the best professors.
abstract: Robert H Frank Economic View column contends federal efforts to control runaway college tuition growth fail to account for the rising salaries that universities are paying to attract the best professors; suggests raising taxes on top salaries would be a good idea for American society in general, shrinking the effect of salary disparities, and generating some much-needed revenue.
lead_paragraph: Federal efforts to control runaway tuition growth fail to account for the rising salaries that universities are paying to attract the best professors.
